interfaces

Interface MemControlStructure

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MSMControlStructure

    public interface MemControlStructure
    This interface contains the necessary methods needed to fully implement a MemControlStructure ADT, a useful ADT for memory management.
    Author:
    samus250

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void freeSpace(int address, int blockSize)
      Records the availability of a block of bytes for future use.
      int reserveMemSpace(int size)
      Searches for an available block of contiguous bytes of the given size (number of bytes) according to the current content of the structure.

    • Method Detail

      • reserveMemSpace

        int reserveMemSpace(int size)
             throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Searches for an available block of contiguous bytes of the given size (number of bytes) according to the current content of the structure. If successful, the structure is modified accordingly to record the space reservation.
        Parameters:
        size - number of bytes to reserve.
        Returns:
        -1 if not successful (no block of available contiguous bytes of the requested size could be found; otherwise, it returns the address of the first byte in the block that was reserved.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - whenever the specified size is either negative or exceeds the size of the memory being manager.

      • freeSpace

        void freeSpace(int address,
               int blockSize)
        throws InvalidAddressException,
               BlockBoundaryViolationException,
               SpaceNotReservedException
        Records the availability of a block of bytes for future use. It basically marks as �available� the specified number of bytes beginning from the byte at the given address.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the first byte to free
        blockSize - the number of bytes to free.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressException - whenever the address given is not valid.
        BlockBoundaryViolationException - whenever the suggested block is out of the boundaries of the memory being managed
        SpaceNotReservedException - whenever some of the bytes in the specified block are already free.
